intro: Pseudocaryophyllus crenatus, commonly known as the wavy leaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. The plant produces small, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments by storing water in its leaves and stems. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it an interesting subject for botanical study in xerophytic ecosystems.
